body.p: Emily Tennyson’s account We drive with Mrs Cameron to see the Carlyles. Mr Carlyle admits us tho’ against rule to admit guests in the morning. We return thro’ Wimbledon Park. Mr Henry Taylor, Mr Lear, Williams, Mr Rossetti, Mr Holman Hunt, Mr Woolner dine. Lady Charlotte & her party come in the evening. All pleased with Mr Lear’s singing. A [Alfred] reads the Morte d’Arthur & Break break after he has sent me to bed. Most hospitably most kindly have we been received by our friends in their houses. We are grateful for all the enjoyment we have had.

Hallam Tennyson’s account March 15th. My father quoted Goethe's “Kennst du das Land?” and “Wer nie sein Brod” at dinner, admiring them greatly. He said he thought that seven of his own best songs (of the deeper kind) were “All along the Valley,” “Courage, poor Heart of Stone,” “Break, Break, Break,” “The Bugle Song,” “Ask me no more,” “Tears, Idle Tears,” and “Crossing the Bar.”
